results.title: Siegfried
results.brief_description: The young God Siegfried, the subject of famed Teutonic legend achieves immortality by bathing in the blood of a slain dragon; one of the hallmark scenes in the history of silent film. An evocative film typical of Lang’s genius which deals with the theme of the extra-personal forces which shape the destiny of humans in a way they cannot always predict or control. “Siegfried” was a nationalistic triumph for Lang and an international success. A classic not to be missed.

results.title: Siegfried
results.creator_credit: Metropolitan Opera, Otto Schenk and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Siefried is the third part of Richard Wagner’s cycle of four operas known as “The Ring of the Nibelung”. This opera follows the adventures of Siefried (Siegfried Jerusalem) as he slays the dragon Fafner to gain possession of the ring which gives mastery of the world. He also rescues Brunhilde (Hildegard Behrens) from the ring of fire where she was imprisoned in “Die Walkure”, the second opera from the cycle. This Metropolitan Opera production of “Siegfried” is entertaining, with great sets and strong performances from the entire cast. The Metropolitan Opera Orchestra is conducted by James Levine. There is no subtitling, enabling the viewer to concentrate on the music and performances. Includes guide in English, Italian and German.

results.title: Siege
results.creator_credit: RKO Pathe Pictures, International Film Foundation, Frederic Ullman, Frank Donovan and Julien Bryan
results.brief_description: Famous documentary by Julien Bryan on the invasion of Poland by the German army in September 1939 - the attack that began World War II. It captures, with powerful images, the terror and desperation of the refugees and the immense destruction in the cities and towns. Depicts the destructive effect on the lives of the people. An important work that shows how unprepared Poland was to face the German war machine. Depicts the first week of WWII, and includes quite graphic footage.

results.title: Sidney Nolan: Such Is Life
results.creator_credit: Waveband Film Productions, RM Arts, Ceidrik Heward, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Channel 4, William Leeson and Brian Adams
results.brief_description: Such is life is a biographical retrospective of Sidney Nolan’s life and work, told in a modern-day journey from Ireland to England, Hong Kong and Australia. Filmed against a background of Sidney Nolan’s past and current projects, it includes the designs for a new opera production for the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, a large graphic suite on themes relevant to Australia’s Bicentennial during 1988 and exhibitions of his new work in London and Hong Kong.

results.title: Sidney Nolan, Mary Nolan: An Australian dream
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Bennetts
results.brief_description: This documentary looks at the history of Australia through the work of artist Sidney Nolan. Discussed is the 18th century and the exploration of Australia by the Europeans, convict settlement, gold discovery through to multiculturalism of the 20th century. Narrated by Frederick Parslow with script written by Elwyn Lynn ‘An Australian dream’ also shows historic footage of Nolan and his exhibition at Heide Museum of Modern Art including music by Percy Grainger on piano roll courtesy of the Grainger Museum.

results.title: Side by side: prejudice
results.brief_description: Friction occurs between two girlfriends - one white, the other Chinese - when the white girl’s boyfriend does not invite the chinese girl to the exclusive Country Club because of her nationality. Raises issues surrounding the values of frienship, and irrational prejudices. No other credits available.

results.title: Sick: the life and death of Bob Flanagan, supermasochist (D)
results.brief_description: The title of this powerful documentary about performance artist and cystic fibrosis sufferer Bob Flanagan hits the mark on two levels. In one sense, it describes his physical condition; Flanagan suffered from the disease all his life and died from it at 43. The second, more evocative reference is to the shockingly direct sadomasochism of the artist’s performances. This is not a film for the squeamish, the prudish, or the faint-hearted. Even hardened viewers may feel disconcerted by Flanagan’s performances, which include piercing and penetrating of almost every body part by practically any sharp object. No other artist in history has examined so literally the experience of pain and the associated pleasures of sadomasochism and domination. Dick was also able to record a great deal of the last two years of Flanagan’s life, including his death, creating as comprehensive a portrait of an artist and his work as possible. (Awards: Winner of the Special Artistic Merit Award, Sundance, 1997).

results.title: Sick puppy [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Bellwether Films, Sally Chesher and Bruce Hancock
results.brief_description: A young boy’s puppy is dying. Anxious not to distress him, his father promises to take him to the circus (All New Moscow Circus) if worst comes to worst. A surprising short about mortality, parenthood and priorities. Cast includes Helen Thomson, David Woodley and Carl Snell.

results.title: Sick at heart (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Debbie Whitmont
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”.
It is more than twenty five years since Aborigines were granted equal rights, but in that time the conditions in which they live have barely changed, and in many instances, because of the introduction of alcohol into their communities, their situation has become more hopeless. The appalling statistics on Aboriginal health - a male life expectancy less than that of Bangladesh, the highest risk of death by murder in the world, are a disgrace to Australia, and whilst there are those who care, there seems to be little hope for the future as whites and blacks alike despair of any easy solution. Paul Barry and the Four Corners team table this generally pessimistic report.
